reviewText: Sheamus is WWE's biggest breakout stars in recent years going from someone who was nothing more than a guy on the ECW roster to WWE Champion in less than a year with more accolades & championships to add to his resume within' the 3 years he's been on the main roster.  This "Superstar Collection" spotlights the biggest matches from his WWE career so far.Tables Match vs. WWE Champion John Cena - Unless you've been heavily paying attention to ECW & RAW for the past few months, your going to say "Who The Hell Is Sheamus?" Well, he's a new face in the heavyweight division known as the "Celtic Warrior" (complete with his own press in Irish newspapers) & was put in the right position for his first major PPV match against Cena in a tables match as it's been proven that Cena's best performances are in these types of "No Rules" matches. They had a good brawl that had the usual moments you would expect but one key thing to pay attention to in this match is the commentary because although people didn't like the ending, it was referenced early in the match and it was a good way to keep both men strong afterwards.T.L.C. '09vs. WWE Champion John Cena vs. Randy Orton vs. Edge - The crowd was very vocal here as we had dueling pro & anti-Cena chants throughout the match but this was very similar to the previous World Title match in that it was a nice brawl between all four men & told some stories about continuing the two individual feuds (Cena/Sheamus & Edge/Orton) while also renewing some old ones (Orton/Cena) and further pushing character development (Edge being the "ultimate opportunist" at the expense of his alliance with Sheamus). However the only down part of this was the ending as you knew it was coming based off the previous two weeks of RAW.Fatal 4 Way '10King Of The Ring Tournament Final vs. John Morrison - A couple of notes here in that Morrison wrestled one more match in the tournament than Sheamus while the ring announcer for this match is the current "Miss U.S.A." who is also scheduled to be on the upcoming season of "WWE Tough Enough." These two told a great story with Sheamus taking a page out of the "Anderson" playbook by completely focusing on Morrison's arm throughout the match with various moves like a single arm DDT, yanking Morrison off the top rope onto his shoulder, hammerlocks & armbars, and even hitting blocking Morrison's "Starship Pain" with knees into his arm. Morrison gave a good effort but this was all about Sheamus being completely ruthless."RAW" Nov. '10[Best Of RAW 2009; Best Of The King Of The Ring]vs. United States Champion Daniel Bryan - To be honest, this match was very short to make anything of note past Sheamus winning the championship & setting up a rematch for both men at WrestleMania...which we all know now was bumped to the pre-show at year."RAW" Mar. '11Royal Rumble Match - This is joined in progress from when Sheamus entered at #22 as the Rumble returns to the traditional format of 30 men with the highlight here being the "match within the match" between Sheamus & Chris Jericho which was one of my favorite "final battle" moments in the Rumble history with it being very competitive & so many moments where both men looked so close to being eliminated and winning that you weren't sure who was going to get the victory.Royal Rumble '12Again, this DVD is doing it's job in showcasing the biggest moments of Sheamus' short career so far (but not exactly the best "quality" matches) & not include too much so you can get through this DVD in just one sitting so I would recommend for Sheamus fans.
summary: From "The Celtic Warrior" To "The Great White"

reviewText: This is just great, I remember the Warlord back when he was in the Powers of Pain and the awesome matches they had with everyone.  I remember Barbarian would tag in Warlord and he would walk around and club a guy here or clothesline a guy there.  When they broke up and he became the Wizard chrome face I was worried his career would take a hit especially with the "W" wand.  When I saw him job to the Bulldog at Wrestlemania 7 I thought he was gone for good.  The he shows up a few years ago and he hasn't missed a beat.  The fact he won the title a few times is even more impressive, especially at his age.  How does this guy keep up with the young guys?  Truly a guy who deserves a DVD after a long and storied career.  I had no idea he was Irish, I miss the full nelson but I guess with yoga he can now do that Bro Kick or whatever.  Now whenever Barb comes back this will be perfect.  A main event wrestlemania match between the two will draw huge at the Spartanburg Armory called American Collesium.
summary: THIS IS AWESOME WHEN DID THE WARLORD GET HIS OWN DVD!
